definition: careless/casual/vague/not so bad/so-so/tolerable/fair
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: He learned carelessly and was not hard-working at all.
sentences.chinese: 他学习马马虎虎，很不用功。

sentences.english: He tinkered with my old clock.
sentences.chinese: 他马马虎虎地修理我的旧钟。

sentences.english: Don't palter with this question, answer it properly.
sentences.chinese: 不要马马虎虎地对待这个问题，好好回答。

sentences.english: He was castigated for his carelessness in doing homework.
sentences.chinese: 他由于做作业时马马虎虎而受到申斥。

sentences.english: He does his work anyhow, without taking any care or trouble over it.
sentences.chinese: 他干起活来马马虎虎，既不当心，又不认真。

sentences.english: B. Just so-so. Are you still working at your old company?
sentences.chinese: 马马虎虎。你还在原来的公司上班吗？

sentences.english: Products must be strictly, not carelessly, inspected before they leave the factory.
sentences.chinese: 产品出厂要严格检查，马马虎虎可不行。

sentences.english: Don’t scamp your work because you are pressed for time.
sentences.chinese: 不要因为时间仓促而马马虎虎。

sentences.english: The female knot-tying weaverbird will refuse to mate with a male who has built a shoddy nest.
sentences.chinese: 会打结的雌织巢鸟不肯同造窝马马虎虎的雄鸟交配。

sentences.english: We went hitchhiking for two weeks and lived catch - as - catch - can.
sentences.chinese: 我们搭便车旅行两周，生活过得马马虎虎。

sentences.english: It was just so-so on the software side.
sentences.chinese: 这只是马马虎虎在软件方面。
汤姆马马虎虎地把钟修了一下。

sentences.english: Mary:just so-so. I am busy in College English Test, Band Four, and you?
sentences.chinese: 马马虎虎，我最近忙于大学英语四级考试。你呢？

sentences.english: Do you acquaint with directional well craft the technique? Yes, know some. So so.
sentences.chinese: 你熟悉定向井工艺技术？知道一些。马马虎虎。

sentences.english: Such slovenly work habits will never produce good products.
sentences.chinese: 这样马马虎虎的工作习惯决不能生产出优质产品来。

sentences.english: Edward:Just so-so. Are you still working at your old company?
sentences.chinese: 马马虎虎。你还在原来的公司上班吗？

definition: lit. can pass through (an opening)/fig. can get by (in life)/tolerably well/not too bad/How are you getting by?/How's life?
to achieve with difficulty/only just up to the task/barely adequate
not up to much/very indifferent/nothing great about it/nothing good to be said about it
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
(coll.) not bad/good/fine
to bring together/to make do in a bad situation/to just get by/to improvise/passable/not too bad
not bad/OK
to not lack
(idiom) just passable/barely satisfactory
(dialect) not that great/not up to much/nothing special
to do with difficulty/to force sb to do sth/reluctant/barely enough
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
better than nothing (idiom)
very good
enough and to spare (idiom)
solemn/presentable/decent
to pass an exam or a test/to meet a minimum standard
